title: AccessChk
desc: AccessChk is a command-line tool for viewing the effective permissions on files, registry keys, services, processes, kernel objects, and more.

title: AccessEnum
desc: This simple yet powerful security tool shows you who has what access to directories, files and Registry keys on your systems. Use it to find holes in your permissions.

title: AdExplorer
desc: Active Directory Explorer is an advanced Active Directory (AD) viewer and editor..

title: AdInsight
desc: An LDAP (Light-weight Directory Access Protocol) real-time monitoring tool aimed at troubleshooting Active Directory client applications.

title: AdRestore
desc: Undelete Server 2003 Active Directory objects.

title: Autologon
desc: Bypass password screen during logon.

title: Autoruns
desc: See what programs are configured to startup automatically when your system boots and you login. Autoruns also shows you the full list of Registry and file locations where applications can configure auto-start settings.

title: BgInfo
desc: This fully-configurable program automatically generates desktop backgrounds that include important information about the system including IP addresses, computer name, network adapters, and more.

title: CacheSet
desc: CacheSet is a program that allows you to control the Cache Manager's working set size using functions provided by NT. It's compatible with all versions of NT.

title: ClockRes
desc: View the resolution of the system clock, which is also the maximum timer resolution.

title: Contig
desc: Wish you could quickly defragment your frequently used files? Use Contig to optimize individual files, or to create new files that are contiguous.

title: Coreinfo
desc: Coreinfo is a new command-line utility that shows you the mapping between logical processors and the physical processor, NUMA node, and socket on which they reside, as well as the cache’s assigned to each logical processor.

title: Ctrl2cap
desc: This is a kernel-mode driver that demonstrates keyboard input filtering just above the keyboard class driver in order to turn caps-locks into control keys. Filtering at this level allows conversion and hiding of keys before NT even "sees" them. Ctrl2cap also shows how to use NtDisplayString() to print messages to the initialization blue-screen.

title: DebugView
desc: Another first from Sysinternals: This program intercepts calls made to DbgPrint by device drivers and OutputDebugString made by Win32 programs. It allows for viewing and recording of debug session output on your local machine or across the Internet without an active debugger.

title: Desktops
desc: This new utility enables you to create up to four virtual desktops and to use a tray interface or hotkeys to preview what’s on each desktop and easily switch between them.

title: Disk2vhd
desc: Disk2vhd simplifies the migration of physical systems into virtual machines (p2v).

title: DiskExt
desc: Display volume disk-mappings.

title: Diskmon
desc: This utility captures all hard disk activity or acts like a software disk activity light in your system tray.

title: DiskView
desc: Graphical disk sector utility.

title: Disk Usage (DU)
desc: View disk usage by directory.

title: EFSDump
desc: View information for encrypted files.

title: FindLinks
desc: FindLinks reports the file index and any hard links (alternate file paths on the same volume) that exist for the specified file.  A file's data remains allocated so long as at it has at least one file name referencing it.

title: Handle
desc: This handy command-line utility will show you what files are open by which processes, and much more.

title: Hex2dec
desc: Convert hex numbers to decimal and vice versa.

title: Junction
desc: Create Win2K NTFS symbolic links.

title: LDMDump
desc: Dump the contents of the Logical Disk Manager's on-disk database, which describes the partitioning of Windows 2000 Dynamic disks.

title: ListDLLs
desc: List all the DLLs that are currently loaded, including where they are loaded and their version numbers.

title: LiveKd
desc: Use Microsoft kernel debuggers to examine a live system.

title: LoadOrder
desc: See the order in which devices are loaded on your WinNT/2K system.

title: LogonSessions
desc: List the active logon sessions on a system.

title: MoveFile
desc: Allows you to schedule move and delete commands for the next reboot.

title: NTFSInfo
desc: and MFT-zone, as well as the sizes of the NTFS meta-data files.

title: PendMoves
desc: Enumerate the list of file rename and delete commands that will be executed the next boot.

title: PipeList
desc: Displays the named pipes on your system, including the number of maximum instances and active instances for each pipe.

title: PortMon
desc: Monitor serial and parallel port activity with this advanced monitoring tool. It knows about all standard serial and parallel IOCTLs and even shows you a portion of the data being sent and received. Version 3.x has powerful new UI enhancements and advanced filtering capabilities.

title: ProcDump
desc: This command-line utility is aimed at capturing process dumps of otherwise difficult to isolate and reproduce CPU spikes. It also serves as a general process dump creation utility and can also monitor and generate process dumps when a process has a hung window or unhandled exception.

title: Process Explorer
desc: Find out what files, registry keys and other objects processes have open, which DLLs they have loaded, and more. This uniquely powerful utility will even show you who owns each process.

title: Process Monitor
desc: Monitor file system, Registry, process, thread and DLL activity in real-time.

title: PsExec
desc: Execute processes on remote systems.

title: PsFile
desc: See what files are opened remotely.

title: PsGetSid
desc: Displays the SID of a computer or a user.

title: PsInfo
desc: Obtain information about a system.

title: PsKill
desc: Terminate local or remote processes.

title: PsPing
desc: Measure network performance.

title: PsList
desc: Show information about processes and threads.

title: PsLoggedOn
desc: Show users logged on to a system.

title: PsLogList
desc: Dump event log records.

title: PsPasswd
desc: Changes account passwords.

title: PsService
desc: View and control services.

title: PsShutdown
desc: Shuts down and optionally reboots a computer.

title: PsSuspend
desc: Suspend and resume processes.

title: RAMMap
desc: An advanced physical memory usage analysis utility that presents usage information in different ways on its several different tabs.

title: RegDelNull
desc: Scan for and delete Registry keys that contain embedded null-characters that are otherwise undeleteable by standard Registry-editing tools.

title: Registry Usage (RU)
desc: View the registry space usage for the specified registry key.

title: RegJump
desc: Jump to the registry path you specify in Regedit.

title: SDelete
desc: Securely overwrite your sensitive files and cleanse your free space of previously deleted files using this DoD-compliant secure delete program.

title: ShareEnum
desc: Scan file shares on your network and view their security settings to close security holes.

title: ShellRunas
desc: Launch programs as a different user via a convenient shell context-menu entry.

title: Sigcheck
desc: Dump file version information and verify that images on your system are digitally signed.

title: Streams
desc: Reveal NTFS alternate streams.

title: Strings
desc: Search for ANSI and UNICODE strings in binary images.

title: Sync
desc: Flush cached data to disk.

title: Sysmon
desc: Monitors and reports key system activity via the Windows event log.

title: TCPView
desc: Active socket command-line viewer.

title: VMMap
desc: VMMap is a process virtual and physical memory analysis utility.

title: VolumeId
desc: Set Volume ID of FAT or NTFS drives.

title: Whois
desc: See who owns an Internet address.

title: WinObj
desc: The ultimate Object Manager namespace viewer is here.

title: ZoomIt
desc: Presentation utility for zooming and drawing on the screen.
